text: Jarvis is an advanced AI assistant built with Next.js and powered by OpenRouter LLMs. It features a RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) system using Pinecone for vector storage, allowing users to chat with their uploaded documents.

The system supports multiple interaction modes: text chat, voice input via Web Speech API, and a command palette for quick actions. Users can upload PDFs and text files which are automatically chunked and embedded for semantic search.

OpenRouter provides access to multiple LLM models. For cost-effective demos, we recommend using google/gemini-flash-1.5 or meta-llama/llama-3.1-8b-instruct which offer excellent performance at low cost. Set MAX_TOKENS to 256 and TEMPERATURE to 0.3 for optimal budget usage.

The dashboard displays real-time information including current time, weather data from OpenWeatherMap API, latest news from NewsAPI, and quick notes. Users can add, edit, and delete notes which are stored in localStorage.

Knowledge Space allows users to manage their uploaded documents. Documents can be pinned for quick access and deleted when no longer needed. Each document shows metadata including size, upload date, and number of chunks created during ingestion.

The conversation summary feature uses OpenRouter to analyze the chat history and extract key topics, action items, and insights. Summaries can be downloaded as PDF or text files for offline reference.

Jarvis implements cost-aware operations to help users stay within their OpenRouter credit budget. The system estimates token usage, caches Pinecone query results, and provides warnings when approaching budget limits.

Dark mode is fully supported with smooth transitions. The UI uses Tailwind CSS for styling and Framer Motion for animations. The color scheme features cyan, blue, and pink gradients inspired by futuristic AI interfaces.
